member.name: T:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.RapidDomain.ExecutionLevel
member.summary: Defines task execution level.
member.remarks:
An execution level basically consists of the RAPID program stack, callchain and PCP. A task has exactly one (or no) current execution level. The three execution levels form a hierarchy, where User is the highest, and Normal is the lowest. That is, if User exists, it is the current level etc.
The normal execution level must exist for the trap or user level to be able to exist. The user execution level can exist without the trap execution level to exist.
When a higher execution level is cleared, the next execution level in the hierarchy is made current, i.e., the PCP is restored etc.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.RapidDomain.ExecutionLevel.None
member.summary: No execution level active.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.RapidDomain.ExecutionLevel.Normal
member.summary: Normal execution level. For normal program execution.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.RapidDomain.ExecutionLevel.Trap
member.summary: Trap execution level. Created by RAPID for execution of trap-routines when RAPID interrupts occur.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.RapidDomain.ExecutionLevel.User
member.summary: User execution level. Created by RAB clients, e.g., for execution of service-routines.

member.name: T:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.RapidDomain.UIInstructionType
member.summary: Defines the UI- and TP- Instructions available in RAPID. For a short description of each instruction type, see "Members" section. For complete description concerning the usage of these RAPID instructions refer to RAPID Technical reference manual.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.RapidDomain.UIInstructionType.UIAlphaEntry
member.summary: The UIAlphaEntry (User Interaction Alpha Entry) is used to let an operator communicate with the robot system via RAPID, by enabling him to enter a string from the FlexPendant or from a PC SDK application. After the operator has entered the text, it is transferred back to the RAPID program by calling .

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.RapidDomain.UIInstructionType.UIListView
member.summary: The UIListView (User Interaction List View) is used to let an operator communicate with the robot system by letting him select one of the items presented in a list. Each list item is defined with a descriptive text and optionally an icon. The selection of the operator is transferred back to the RAPID program by calling .

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.RapidDomain.UIInstructionType.UIMessageBox
member.summary: UIMessageBox (User Interaction Message Box, advanced type) is used to display a message (usually a question) to the operator. The answer of the operator, i. e. the selected MessageBox button, is transferred back to the RAPID program by calling .

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.RapidDomain.UIInstructionType.UIMsgBox
member.summary: UIMsgBox (User Interaction Message Box, basic type)is used to display a message (usually a question) to the operator. The answer of the operator, i. e. the selected MessageBox button, is transferred back to the RAPID program by calling . (UIMessageBox and UIMsgBox do not differ much, see details in RAPID Technical reference manual.)

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.RapidDomain.UIInstructionType.UINumEntry
member.summary: UINumEntry (User Interaction Number Entry) is used to enable the operator to enter a numeric value from the available user device, such as the FlexPendant or a PC SDK application. The numeric value specified by the user is transferred back to the RAPID program by calling .

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.RapidDomain.UIInstructionType.UINumTune
member.summary: UINumTune (User Interaction Number Tune) is used to allow the operator to tune a numeric value from the FlexPendant or a PC SDK application. The numeric value specified by the operator is transferred back to the RAPID program by calling .

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.RapidDomain.UIInstructionType.TPErase
member.summary: TPErase (Teach Pendant Erase) is used to clear the display from written messages.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.RapidDomain.UIInstructionType.TPReadFK
member.summary: TPReadFK (Teach Pendant Read Function Key) is used to display a question to the operator, who responds by selecting one out of 2-5 displayed "function keys". The response, i. e. which function key was selected is transferred back to the program by calling .

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.RapidDomain.UIInstructionType.TPReadNum
member.summary: TPReadNum is used to display a question to the operator via the available user device, such as the FlexPendant or a PC SDK application. The user responds by entering a number, which is transferred back to the RAPID program by calling .

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.RapidDomain.UIInstructionType.TPWrite
member.summary: TPWrite is used to display written information to the operator.

member.summary: Post event type, eg. TPWrite, TPErase

member.summary: Send event type, UI-Instructions of this type can be aborted/closed/confirmed, eg. TPReadNum, UIListView

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.RapidDomain.UIInstructionEventType.Abort
member.summary: UI-Instruction aborted/closed/confirmed by the operator. If you receive a new Send event type from the same task, the previous dialog should be removed and the new dialog displayed, as a RAPID task can only handle one dialog. This may happen if RAPID execution is stopped while a UI-Instruction dialog is being displayed, then restarted and executing a new UIInstruction.

member.name: T:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.RapidDomain.UIInstruction
member.summary: Provides the public UIInstruction interface, available in RW 5.12 and later. There is only one UIInstruction object per object, which is accessible through the property.

member.name: E:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.RapidDomain.UIInstruction.UIInstructionEvent
member.summary: Unspecified UI-Instruction event (in RW 5.12 or later).

remarks.para: Cannot be used with RW releases earlier than RW 5.12!
To transfer the response of the operator back to the RAPID program you cast the event argument object received with the event to an object of the correct type and call its SendAnswer method.

member.name: T:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.RapidDomain.TaskPanelExecutionMode
member.summary: Determines how static and semiStatic RAPID tasks should be affected by start and stop operations.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.RapidDomain.TaskPanelExecutionMode.NormalTasks
member.summary: Use Task Panel state for all normal tasks. When used with Start(), static/semistatic tasks will always be started, regardless of task panel state. When used with Stop(), static/semistatic tasks will never be stopped. This is the default.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.RapidDomain.TaskPanelExecutionMode.AllTasks
member.summary: Use Task Panel state for all tasks.

member.summary: Execution stopped due to the RAPID instruction EXIT.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.RapidDomain.ExecutionEventInfo.StopReady
member.summary: Execution stopped because no more cycles.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.RapidDomain.ExecutionEventInfo.StopUserRoutineReady
member.summary: Execution stopped because the end of a user routine was reached (routine called on user demand).

member.summary: Execution stopped because cannot execute backward past beginning.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.RapidDomain.ExecutionEventInfo.StopAtStructure
member.summary: Execution stopped because cannot execute backward past structure.

member.name: P:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.RapidDomain.Rapid.Cycle
member.summary: Get/sets the behavior of the execution cycle. It can also be used to set the remaining cycle counter, even though it is recommended to control this by using the RemaningCycles property.
member.remarks:
Execution cycle is normally set through the Start( ... ) method. Setting this property is only applicable to running RAPID programs.
Set Requires Mastership of Rapid domain. Set Requires UAS_RAPID_EXECUTE grant. Set Requires Auto mode.

member.name: P:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.RapidDomain.Rapid.RemainingCycles
member.summary: Gets/Sets the remaining cycle counter.
member.remarks:
This is normally set through the Start( ... ) method. Setting this property is only applicable to running RAPID programs.
Set Requires Mastership of Rapid domain. Set Requires UAS_RAPID_EXECUTE grant. Set Requires Auto mode.

member.name: E:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.RapidDomain.Rapid.ExecutionCycleChanged
member.summary: Raised when the execution cycle is changed. Supported from RW5.09.

member.name: E:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.RapidDomain.Rapid.ExecutionStatusChanged
member.summary: Raised when the program execution status of the controller changes. The execution status corresponds to the CycleOn system output, i.e. whether any normal task is executing or a regain is under way. In other words, if the robot(s) may be moving.
member.remarks: The event does NOT react to start or stop of RAPID event routines, such as RESET, START, STOP, POWER_ON etc.

member.name: E:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.RapidDomain.Rapid.ExecutionChanged
member.summary: Raised when a program execution event occurs.
member.remarks: Use this event for more detailed information about program execution events than provided by the event . For example, this event reacts to RAPID event routines that are started and stopped by the system e.g. RESET, START, STOP, POWER_ON etc.

member.name: E:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.RapidDomain.Rapid.MastershipChanged
member.summary: This event is raised then the mastership of the resource is changed.

member.name: E:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.RapidDomain.Rapid.RapidDataResolve
member.summary: This event is raised prior when a IRapidData object shall be created as the value for a RapidData object. Any listener shall, if possible, return a fresh instance of a corresponding type that implements IRapidData. This event will be raised until a instance is created or all listeners have been called. If resolve wasn't possible a UserDefined instance will be created for the data.

member.name: E:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.RapidDomain.Rapid.TaskEnabledChanged
member.summary: This event is raised when the task enabled property changes.

member.summary: WI 12077 Resolved Rapid Related Unit Test Cases Helper function called when to get rapid data of size > 1024 for non array Ex: Url for "/RAPID/T_ROB1/Sample/RnGroupTestValue" is made to "/RAPID/T_ROB1/Sample/RnGroupTestValue{1}" _col is used to loop count, then string will be appended to get final result.

member.summary: Checks whether the RAPID data is an array (of one or several dimensions).

member.name: P:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.RapidDomain.RapidData.IsTaskPers
member.summary: Checks whether the RAPID data is declared PERS or TASKPERS. Only of interest for persistent data.
member.value: true if the RAPID data is declared TASKPERS; otherwise false.
member.remarks: Will return false if used with RapidData that is not declared as persistent (but constant for example).

member.name: P:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.RapidDomain.RapidData.IsLocal
member.summary: Checks whether the RAPID data is declared locally.
member.value: true if the RAPID data is not declared in a global module.
member.remarks: Will always return false when used with RapidData of Atomic, RecordComponent or Parameter.

member.name: P:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.RapidDomain.Task.Enabled
member.summary:
Gets or sets the Enabled state of the Task. 'Enabled' is also referred to as activated/deactivated in the user interface. Returns true if the task is activated in the task selection panel and will react to start requests. Returns false if the task is deactivated and will not react to start requests.
The Enabled state can only be changed by a local controller client and is not allowed by remote clients.
RobotStudio connects to virtual controllers, that belongs to a station, as a local client. In all other scenarios, only the FlexPendant is connected as a local client. Other clients are remote.
member.remarks:
The Enabled state can only be changed by a local controller client and is not allowed by remote clients.
Set requires controller to be in auto mode. Requires Mastership.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.RapidDomain.Task.DeleteProgram
member.summary: Deletes the RAPID program of the task from the controller program memory.
member.remarks:
All program modules of the task will be deleted from program memory. If they have been saved they will however remain in the controller file system.
Requires mastership of RAPID domain.
Requires the grant.
Use if you want to load another program directly after the deletion.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.RapidDomain.Task.DeleteProgram(System.Int32)
member.summary: Deletes the RAPID program of the task from the controller program memory. Returns as soon as the execution of the RESET event routine is ready.
member.remarks:
THIS METHOD ONLY WORKS WITH RW 5.12 AND LATER!
All program modules of the task will be deleted from program memory. If they have been saved they will however remain in the controller file system.
Requires mastership of RAPID domain.
Requires the grant.
When a RAPID program has been deleted the controller program server executes a RESET event routine a short while. This method returns as soon as the program server is ready to load another RAPID program.
member.exception: The method did not finish within the specified time limit.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.RapidDomain.Task.GetRapidData(System.String[])
member.summary: Gets a object that references a RAPID data instance in the robot controller.
member.param: An array of strings, which specifies where in the RAPID domain the RAPID data is declared.
member.returns: A object. If the RAPID data doesn't exist null is returned.
member.remarks:
If you do not know the name of the module where the data is declared SearchRapidSymbol(...) can be used.
To access RAPID data in a shared module just send the name of the data as parameter, see the second example below.
NOTE! RAPID data declared in a - Hidden or -Shared -Hidden module cannot be accessed.
member.exception: rapidData is null or length is less then 1

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.RapidDomain.Task.LoadProgramFromFile(System.String,ABB.Robotics.Controllers.RapidDomain.RapidLoadMode)
member.summary: Loads a RAPID program to the controller program memory
member.param: Path to the file containing the RAPID program. Valid extension for a RAPID program file is .pgf.

remarks.para: Use if you need to make another call to the RAPID program server, eg. , directly after having loaded the program.

member.returns: True if loading succeeds without any build errors, otherwise false.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.RapidDomain.Task.LoadProgramFromFile(System.String,ABB.Robotics.Controllers.RapidDomain.RapidLoadMode,System.Int32)
member.summary: Loads a RAPID program to the controller program memory. Returns as soon as the execution of the RAPID RESET event routine is ready.
member.param: Path to the file containing the RAPID program. Valid extension for a RAPID program file is .pgf.
member.returns: True if loading succeeds without any build errors, otherwise false.
member.remarks:
THIS METHOD ONLY WORKS WITH RW 5.12 AND LATER!
Requires mastership of RAPID domain.
Requires the grant.
The program server will be busy executing a RAPID event routine a short while after the program has been loaded. This method returns as soon as the controller program server is ready for another call.
member.exception: The method did not finish within the specified time limit.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.RapidDomain.Task.UnloadProgram
member.summary: Deletes the RAPID program of the task from the controller program memory.
member.remarks:
All program modules of the task will be deleted from program memory. If they have been saved they will however remain in the controller file system.
Requires auto mode. Requires mastership of RAPID domain.
Requires the grant.
If another program is to be loaded after the deletion you may need to use a short delay, as the controller program server must finish a RAPID event routine before it can do anything else.

The name of the routine to which program pointer will be set.
member.remarks:

Requires automatic mode.
member.exception: Program pointer is not set because one or both parameters are wrong.

member.returns: Less than zero - This instance is less than obj. Zero - This instance is equal to obj. Greater than zero - This instance is greater than obj.

member.name: T:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.ConfigurationHandler
member.summary:
this class handles the internal configuration of the controller api. This class must be public with a default ctor to enable reflection creation from the runtime when the configuration is requested.
Todo when adding a new section: - Create a new parser method with signature void Method(); - Implement the parser with a simple check for the section and a trace if the section is missing. - Add trace statements to TraceConfiguration(). - Create default values on the CapiConfig class to keep the api less sensitive to bad config files. - Register the parser _sectionParsers array to enable execution.

member.summary: creates the configuration object

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.Controller.ReleaseUnmanagedResources
member.summary: Releases unmanaged resources, thus preventing memory leaks. If the PC SDK application is running in a Single Threaded Apartment (STA), the Dispose call will dispose of managed objects, but native objects created internally by the PC SDK will remain. To release these unmanaged resources, this method should be called periodically.
member.remarks: For an application running in a Multi Threaded Apartment (MTA) the Dispose call will remove both managed and native objects.

member.summary: Performs a Restore operation of a controller system.
member.param: Defines what to restore from the backup.

member.remarks: Requires mastership of Rapid and Configuration domains. Requires UAS_RESTORE grant. Requires Auto mode.

member.param: Defines what to restore from the backup.
Defines what mismatches between current system and backup to ignore.
Flag to indicate if the backup folder shall be removed.
member.remarks:
Requires mastership of Rapid and Configuration domains. Requires UAS_RESTORE grant. Requires Auto mode.
On a Virtual Controller the restore operation will delete the content of the temporary folder (TEMP)$.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.Grant.AdministrateSystem
member.summary: Gives access to perform the following: Install new system, P-start, I-start, X-start, C-start, Select System, Install system from device. This grant gives full FTP access, that is, the grant gives the same rights as access to controller disks and access to controller disks.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.Grant.AuthenticationSystemAdministration
member.summary: Gives access to read and write the UAS configuration, that is to read, add, remove and modify UAS users and groups.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.Grant.BackupController
member.summary: Gives access to perform a backup and to save modules, programs and configuration files.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.Grant.CalibrateRobot
member.summary: Gives access to perform the following: Fine calibrate mechanical unit, Calibrate base frame, Update/clear SMB data. Note! Frame calibration (tool, wobj) requires the grant RAPID code. Manual offset of mechanical unit calibration data and loading new calibration data from file require grant Modify configuration.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.Grant.ClearEventLog
member.summary: Gives access to delete messages in the controller Event Log.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.Grant.DebugRapid
member.summary: Gives access to perform the following: Move PP to routine, Move PP to cursor, HoldToRun, Activate/deactivate RAPID tasks, Request write access from the FlexPendant, Acknowledge Auto mode without restoring simulated I/O signals or deactivated tasks, Enable/disable non-motion execution

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.Grant.DecreaseProductionSpeed
member.summary: Gives acces to decrease speed from 100% in Auto mode. This grant is not required if speed already is below 100%, or controller is in Manual mode.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.Grant.EditRapidModule
member.summary: Gives access to perform the following: Modify code in existing RAPID modules, Frame calibration (tool, workobj), Commit ModPos/HotEdit positions to current values, Rename program.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.Grant.ExecuteRapid
member.summary: Gives access to perform the following: Start/step program (stop is always allowed), Move PP to Main, Execute service routines.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.Grant.FullAccess
member.summary: This grant includes all controller grants, also new grants added in future RobotWare versions. The grant does not include any application grants, nor the "Safety Controller configuration" grant.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.Grant.HotEditRapid
member.summary: Hot Edit

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.Grant.ModifyRapidPosition
member.summary: Gives access to perform the following: Modify or teach positions in RAPID code (ModPos), During execution modify positions in RAPID code single points or as a path (HotEdit), Restore ModPos/HotEdit positions to original, Modify current value of any RAPID variable.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.Grant.ModifyRapidDataValue
member.summary: Gives access to modify current value of any RAPID variable. The grant is a subset of grant "Perform ModPos and HotEdit".
member.remarks: Supported from RW 5.07.03

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.Grant.ModifyRapidProgram
member.summary: Modify Rapid program

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.Grant.WriteIO
member.summary: Gives access to perform the following: Set I/O signal value, Set signal as simulated and remove simulation, Set I/O unit and bus as enabled/disabled

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.Grant.ReadFtp
member.summary: Gives external read access to controller disks. This grant is \only valid for explicit disk access, for example with an FTP client or the File Manager of RoboStudio Online.
member.remarks:
It is possible, for example, to load a program from /hd0a without this grant. To this effect the following grants also allow file system browsing; , ,
and .

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.Grant.RemoteWarmStart
member.summary: Gives access to perform warm start and shutdown (S-start) from a remote location. No grant is required to perform warm start via a local device, as for example the FlexPendant.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.Grant.RestoreController
member.summary: Gives access to restore backup and perform B-start.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.Grant.WriteConfiguration
member.summary: Gives access to modify the configuration database, that is load configuration files, change system parameter values and add/delete instances.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.Grant.WriteControllerProperty
member.summary: Gives access to set controller name, controller ID and system clock.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.Grant.WriteFtp
member.summary: Gives external write access to controller disks. This grant is only valid for explicit disk access, for example with an FTP client or the File Manager of RoboStudio Online. It is possible, for example, to save a program to the controller disk or perform a backup without this grant.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.Grant.LoadRapidProgram
member.summary: Gives access to load/delete modules and program.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.Grant.SafetyControllerConfiguration
member.summary: Gives access to perform a configuration of the Safety Controller. Only valid for the PSC-option. This grant is not included in the "Full access" grant.
member.remarks: Supported from RW 5.07

member.summary: Gets the mask information on a unit. It contains what bits in the "data area" that are valid. (There are units that has a size which is not a multiple of 8 bits). If a bit is "1" in the "mask area" the corresponding bit in the "data area" is valid.

member.name: T:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.Messaging.IpcQueue
member.summary: This type represents an Ipc queue, which can be used to send data between the controller and its clients. IPC can be used with RW 5.10 and later. Messages can be sent to the queue from other clients who knows the queue id. Only the creator of the queue can recieve messages from the queue.
member.remarks: Messages must be sent and recieved from a MTA thread. This means that you shall not send and recieve messages from the UI thread. See for more information.

member.name: P:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.Messaging.IpcQueue.QueueName
member.summary: Returns the name of the Ipc queue.

member.name: P:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.Messaging.IpcQueue.QueueId
member.summary: Returns the ID of the Ipc queue.

member.name: P:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.Messaging.IpcQueue.Capacity
member.summary: Returns the capacity (max number of elements) of the queue.

member.name: P:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.Messaging.IpcQueue.MessageSizeLimit
member.summary: Returns the size limitation for a message.

member.name: P:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.Messaging.IpcQueue.RemoteAccessible
member.summary: Specifies whether the queue is remotely accessible or not.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.Messaging.IpcQueue.#ctor(ABB.Robotics.Controllers.IController,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.Messaging.IpcQueue.Send(ABB.Robotics.Controllers.Messaging.IpcMessage)
member.summary: This method sends a message to a RAPID queue.
member.remarks:
IPC can only be used with RW 5.10 and later.
There must be code to receive the message in the RAPID program.
No mastership is required to send a message.
This method must be called from a MTA thread. Create a separate sender thread and use the method Thread.SetApartmentState() to set the apartment state to MTA before starting it.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.Messaging.IpcQueue.Send(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Byte[])
member.summary: This method sends a message to the queue.

remarks.para: This method must be called from a MTA thread. Create a separate sender thread and use the method Thread.SetApartmentState() to set the apartment state to MTA before starting it.

member.param: The data that will be sent
member.exception: if Data is invalid.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.Messaging.IpcQueue.Send(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: This method sends a message to the queue.

remarks.para: This method must be called from a MTA thread. Create a separate sender thread and use the method Thread.SetApartmentState() to set the apartment state to MTA before starting it.

member.param: The data that will be sent
Length of the data that will be sent
member.exception: if Data is invalid.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.Messaging.IpcQueue.Receive(System.Int32,ABB.Robotics.Controllers.Messaging.IpcMessage)
member.summary: This method receives a message from the queue.
member.remarks:
IPC can only be used with RW 5.10 and later.
This method must be called from a MTA thread. Create a separate reciever thread and use the method Thread.SetApartmentState() to set the apartment state to MTA before starting it.
Calls to this method are blocking.
member.exception: QueueId is invalid.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Controllers.Mastership.Ensure(ABB.Robotics.Controllers.IMastershipResource)
member.summary: Ensure method helps for temporarily obtaining mastership for a Controller with MastershipPolicy set to Automatic (typically a VC).
member.returns: An object holding mastership of a specific resource.
member.remarks: The operating mode is automatically set to Automatic for a VC connection if needed. Resources that were already held are not released when the returned token is disposed. If the Controller has MastershipPolicy set to Manual, or if the requested resources are already held, this method does nothing.

member.name: F:Adapters.Rapid.AdaptUIInstructionEventType.Abort
member.summary: UI-Instruction aborted/closed/confirmed by the operator. If you receive a new Send event type from the same task, the previous dialog should be removed and the new dialog displayed, as a RAPID task can only handle one dialog. This may happen if RAPID execution is stopped while a UI-Instruction dialog is being displayed, then restarted and executing a new UIInstruction.

members.member:
Calculate cartesian position for the mechunit.
The tool. The current tool is used if empty string (or null) The workobject. Used if coord is RobCoordSystem.Wobj, ignored for other values of coord. The current workobject is used if empty string (or null).
Get the current position for the given tool (TCP) in the given workobject expressed in the given coordinate system. Only IRB mechunits can return a cartesian position.

The workobject. Used if coord is RobCoordSystem.Wobj, ignored for other values of coord. The current workobject is used if empty string (or null).
member.remarks: Get the current position for the given tool (TCP) in the given workobject expressed in the given coordinate system. Only IRB mechunits can return a cartesian position.
